column4: Can someone here help me get samba as an option in the shared folders settings?
Can anyone here help me get samba as an option in the shared folders settings?
go to system->administartion->shared folders then click "add" and it should prompt you if you want to use samba or unix file sharing.  if you choose samba, it will install itself
it doesn't ask... it just defaults to nfs and doesn't let me add samba
http://doc.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/serverguide/C/installing-samba.html ...that should walk you through the whole process!
I already did that... samba is installed and has been installed... it just doesn't give me a choice of that in the shared folder settings
yes, i have samba, but i dont seem to have the default config file, check /ect/samba/smb.conf and tell me your findings please
see pastebin http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/496/ for a text based solution
you have been answered twice, now ill ask nicly to leave once more
